description:
The app works fairly well for most devices, however if you have any problems at all, you'll need to join their Discord and deal with the most out of touch, condecending, piece of isht children you've ever dealt with. Their Discord is like interacting with an CoD XBox lobby. Their SDK Devs are children who only want to belittle people on discord. It's a worthless trial to troubleshoot anything with their ilk.

Avoid this project like the plague.
summary: Dont fscking bother with this app

description: It Keeps Crashing everytime i Pick a color or do anything on this app.

You need to install this and reboot first:

rpm-ostree install openrgb-udev-rules

this is just the 'basic' app, a few extra steps are required… you need to install the udev script as instructed, and i would recommend to download 2 plugins from their website… rgb effects and visual map. but the end result is fantastic and absolutely worth the effort
If your device is supported this is a must have tool!
Works much better than the Asus windows bloatware that came with my motherboard. Setting are persistent too!

You might need to add udev rules to get proper permissions. Without that OpenRGB will not show any devices. Check https://gitlab.com/CalcProgrammer1/OpenRGB#installing-udev-rules-manually for instructions.
Very good software, just works on Fedora without needing to do anything other than installing it which is grand!
summary: Works with my Gamemax Strike keyboard

description: Definitely a must-have for anyone with RGB-controllable hardware. Let's you control your devices without some terrible OEM app
Another review claims I can install the rules manually to get it working, but it won't let me copy any files to the location needed to get it working. So far not working for me.
summary: Sounds Great but can't get it to detect anything

description: Finally, I can control the LED strip on my GPU! I have a Gigabyte RTX 3080 with an annoying built-in profile. I couldn't change it until today!
Crashes on startup, doesnt work. horay.
works great with Logitech keyboard and mouse
doesnt work. expects me to download and replace files. no way thats why i got it on discover 0/10 wouldnt recommend
requires to replace some files. mostly works only for Logitech devices
guess its asking too much for the app to do what it is supposed to do and or install drivers as needed what a joke
When I try to add the Udev file into the folder it says permission denied for some reason even though I am the only user on this PC and have updated permissions and all that jazz.
One of the builds that does not detect my NZXT Hue 2 Ambient properly & asks for zoning, which shouldn't be necessary. Applying any sort of color just turns them off.

1) Go to https://gitlab.com/CalcProgrammer1/OpenRGB#installing-udev-rules-manually. 

2) Download the latest udev rules file from the clickable link.

3) Go to download directory

4) sudo mv 60-openrgb.rules /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/

5) reload the app.

All of my devices were found besides my graphics card doing it this way.
summary: Make sure to install the UDEV rules MANUALLY!!

description: I have ThermalTake Pure Plus 12 Fans and a Razer Chromata RGB keyboard and it detected both fine. I had to configure the RGB Zones for the fans by copying the provided link in the app - good if you know the exact brand and model of your fans (in my case the fans have 9 zones). I was able to change the colors of the fans and keyboard with a few clicks which is what I needed. Doesn't seem like I can do more than that but I haven't delved deeper into it.

I love this application I actually use it's with my steam deck through my dock!
An I connect all my logitech Branded products an it's work great would highly recommended for anyone that's want an RGB keyboard an Mouse on their steam deck. I find that's Logitech G products work very well with this software. I would also like to say thanks to everyone who made this software they did an Amazing job! An if anyone is wonder I have tried Hyper X mouse an some other brands an they do work very well on OpenRGB.
Some devices take extra work, but overall, the application works very well
Thanks, it was an easy solution to just change the rgb on my logitech g733, THX
This makes controlling all different RGB controllers very easy. You don't have to fiddle around with every piece of your sick RGB setup. Everything in one place.
Control rgb, but open
Since they added support for the obscure RGB devices I have it's such a blessing!

Unfortunately, when it comes to programs from big manufacturers, you have to get more and more upset that somehow the only thing that works is the advertising and the data recovery window (give me your credit card number).

This program works very well straight away.

The only thing that isn't being controlled right now is the ADATA XPG Lancer.
summary: A bit better than the ASUS Armory Crate

description: detecto todos mis equipos solo el unico fue al tarjeta grafica asus strix
summary: funciona pero faltan placas de video
